CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "Ernest Bossie, 2334 Wylie Avenue, Silver Bar and Grill, 1911 Centre Avenue: 'No, We can't join the bartenders union.  They refuse to take Negroes in union at all.  In fact, the only way they'll take us in the AFL is as a porter or waiter.  I'm not in favor of affiliating ourselves with those guys.'"
TitMainTitle: Three men, including bartender Ernest Bossie in center wearing zippered cardigan and holding cigar, gathered at bar with boxing pictures and sign reading "please pay when served," in Silver Bar and Grill, 1911 Centre Avenue
